column7: IDP is a global leader in international educational services. We've been in the industry for nearly 50 years and know the best practices to help you realise your dream of studying abroad. Our range of services, experienced staff, and foothold in the industry ensures that your international future is bright and rewarding.

column6: Entities included in the organization's sustainability reporting
column7: IDP Education Limited (the Company) and its controlled subsidiaries (the Group). IDP Education Limited is a for-profit company limited by shares whose shares are publicly traded on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX)

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column7: As an Australian-listed company, we operate in over 80 countries worldwide, empowering people to achieve global study, work and migration goals. We specialise in combining human expertise with our leading technology to help individuals gain admission to their ideal course, take an English language test or learn English in our schools.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column7: As a leader in international education, IDP's services include student placement, English language testing, teaching, digital marketing, and data insights.

column13: A few of our people receive an Emerging Leaders Award each year, joining a prestigious leadership mentoring program. It includes mentorship sessions with our Global Leadership Team, access to high-quality learning resources and sponsorship for leadership development.
column20: Leadership Development, Mentorship Program, Professional Growth

column13: Our collective performance leads to overall business success. Everyone is encouraged to take charge of their personal and professional growth, and we support this through a wide range of learning and development opportunities. We do this by setting clear team goals, discussing achievements and exploring development opportunities. We celebrate and acknowledge outstanding performance.
column20: Learning Opportunities, Personal Growth, Performance Recognition

column13: At IDP, we recognise and appreciate that our 6,800 people worldwide bring unique experiences and talents to our organisation. We aim to create a high-performance environment where everyone can thrive and contribute their strengths, driving our team's engagement, growth and overall success.
column20: High-Performance Environment, Employee Engagement, Team Success

column7: The Remuneration, Nomination, and Audit and Risk Committee support the Board.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column7: The Nomination Committee's role is to identify suitable candidates to complement the existing Board and make recommendations to the Board on their appointment. The identification of potential director candidates may be assisted by using external search organisations as appropriate. Before appointing a director, the Company undertakes comprehensive checks, including directorships, identifying conflicts of interest, character reference, criminal history, bankruptcy and disqualified company director checks.

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Peter was appointed Non-Executive Director and Chair of IDP Education in March 2007 and became Chair of IDP Education Limited when the Company was listed on the Australian Stock Exchange in November 2015.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column7: The Board is responsible for the overall management of the Company and for directing its strategic goals to increase shareholder value through maximising the performance of the Company.

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column7: The Board has delegated authority over the day-to-day management of the Company and its operations to the CEO and the senior executive team.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column7: Social responsibility Ã¢ÂÂ We consider the social, ethical and environmental impact of the Company's activities and operations, setting standards and monitoring Compliance with the Company's social responsibilities and practices.

A conflict of interest arises when we put our personal, social, financial or political interests before the interests of IDP. Conflicts of interest are to be avoided because, besides the legal concerns, they can show that IDP does not undertake business fairly and ethically.

IDP has developed a program of investor engagement to ensure effective two-way communication with shareholders, the media and the broader investment community. The key channels currently utilised by IDP to distribute information to shareholders include annual full and half-year Financial Reports, investor presentations and notices of annual general meetings.

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column7: The Board's policy is that the directors comprise an appropriate mix of skills to provide the necessary breadth and depth of knowledge and experience to meet the Board's responsibilities and objectives. It is intended that the Board will consist of directors with a broad range of skills, expertise, and experience from diverse backgrounds, including gender.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column7: Board effectiveness is monitored through an annual survey assessing the effectiveness of the Board's performance against critical responsibilities. The survey also addresses the effectiveness of the Board Committees in assisting the Board to meet its obligations. Upon completion of the survey, a report is produced, which the Board discusses.

We intend to set executive remuneration that is fair, equitable, competitive and appropriate for the markets in which we operate, is mindful of internal relativities and ensures that the mix and balance of remuneration is suitable to attract, motivate, retain and fairly reward all senior executives and other key employees and is consistent with contemporary Corporate Governance standards.

The Board reviews Executive KMP remuneration each year to ensure remuneration remains fair and reasonable, and market competitive while continuing to drive outstanding annual business performance. The review in FY23 included an independent benchmark report against two bespoke comparator groups comprising ASX-listed companies of similar size, type and market capitalisation.

We completed our first comprehensive materiality assessment, which has provided valuable insights into setting our agenda for the coming years. Our sustainability strategy aligns with our business priorities and is an integral part of our way of operating. IDP Annual Report 2023 Our sustainability strategy addresses the most significant topics, meets stakeholder expectations and contributes to the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

Our commitment to our core values of Community, Caring, Expertise, Integrity and Quality drives our teams to deliver outstanding service that makes a difference. These values are deeply ingrained in our organisation and reflected in our people, customers and work.
We are committed to respecting individual differences, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels a sense of belonging and ensuring fair and respectful treatment for all.
We are committed to conducting business responsibly and ethically, meeting the expectations of our stakeholders while upholding our high standards.

We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment in which everyone is treated fairly and with respect and where everyone feels responsible for the reputation and performance of the Company.

At IDP, we are committed to building a sustainable future and creating positive change by enabling people to achieve their global ambitions. Our Sustainable Futures strategy reflects IDP's aspiration to make a meaningful impact on our communities, people, and the environment, striving towards a more balanced and equitable world for all.

IDP is committed to identifying and retaining the best talent to drive business growth and performance. We reward and promote our team based on assessment of individual performance, capability and potential.

column13: The risk management policy is supported by a global risk management framework (which adopts the risk management process described in the Australian/ New Zealand Standard (AS/NZS ISO 31000:2018 Risk management Ã¢ÂÂ Guidelines)). It applies in addition to the Company's other policies. The Board is satisfied that the risk management policy remains relevant to the current needs of the Company and the Board.
column20: Risk Management Policy, Global Framework, Compliance Audits

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: This Policy aims to ensure that all eligible Persons can report instances, or suspected cases, of unethical, improper, unlawful or undesirable conduct without fear of intimidation or reprisal. This Policy is intended to encourage and promote honest and ethical behaviour by providing a transparent process for eligible Persons to escalate concerns about actual, suspected or anticipated wrongdoing within the Company.
column20: Whistleblower Policy, Ethics Reporting, Compliance Training

column13: Our Group Internal Audit function conducts regular audits across our network, including country management and operations, to assess compliance with IDP's global policies. Our internal audits encompass a review of local laws and regulations, including controls for managing compliance with business licences, tax and financial reporting obligations and other significant laws and regulations such as privacy or wages and employment benefits.
column20: Internal Audits, Compliance Reviews, Policy Adherence

column13: In addition, we conducted our annual global compliance training for all IDP team members, focusing on our Code of Conduct. The training covers anti-bribery and anti-corruption, privacy, cybersecurity and whistleblowing.

column7: We partner with more than 800 leading universities, schools and colleges across Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and the United States. With access to a database of over 180,000 courses and programmes, we can help you find what fits you best.
